comp249_assignment1

Class LadderAndSnake

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp249_assignment1.LadderAndSnake

  • public class LadderAndSnake
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Ladder and Snake game. Creating an instance of this class will create the game. All necessary methods for the game functionalities are called within this class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean isManual
      determines if the game automatically plays out or if it is manually played

      static int nbTurns

      Player[] player, the player array of player objects.

        Default constructor for the LadderAndSnake that will set the nbPlayers to 2

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayOrder

        private void setPlayOrder()
        Sets order of who starts by rolling the dice and checking who rolled a greater number. If both players roll the same dice it increments the number of attempts and goes back in the loop. Prints the name of who starts and breaks the while loop.

      • flipDice

        private int flipDice()
        this method returns a random integer value between 1 and 6.
        Returns:
        int between 1 and 6

      • reversePlayers

        private void reversePlayers()
        Reverses the players position

      • waitForInput

        private void waitForInput(comp249_assignment1.Player p)
        This method uses the Scanner to wait for the player to type 'f' to continue playing. If the static variable isManual is set to false this method will be ignored
        Parameters:
        p, - current player that is rolling the dice

      • play

        public void play()
        This method will start the ladder and snake game.It creates a board object, creates the players and sets their order. At every player's dice roll it checks for any events depending on their current position (e.g. snakes, ladders or other players) and it updates their position and board location. The board is printed after each turn. The game will only end when a player reaches the board position 100.

      • getNbPlayers

        public int getNbPlayers()
        getter that returns the integer number of players
        Returns:
        numbers of players playing the game
